title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 5 ยง 240.1 - Purpose and general description
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 5 ยง 240.1 - Purpose and general description

State Regulations

The purpose of these regulations is to set forth the
application process by which a qualified musical and theatrical production
company may apply for benefits under the Empire State Musical and Theatrical

Production Tax Credit Program established by chapter 59 of the Laws of 2014. These regulations establish procedures for the allocation of such credits, including, but not limited to, the application process, standards for
evaluating applications, and such other provisions deemed necessary and
appropriate. The New York State department of Economic Development shall
administer the program, including the issuance of tax credit
certificates. Notes

Adopted

New

York State Register August 12, 2015/Volume XXXVII, Issue 32, eff. 8/12/2015

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
